intro: Thesium asperulum, commonly known as the rough thesium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered with fine, stiff hairs. Thesium asperulum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
